page.title: 09CERES PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {Ceres Parish Church was built in 1806 and is easily seen from all around standing on a hill in the centre of the village.The church is famous for {its box pews}which are used in{Long {Table Communion}to this day. These box pews are separated by pieces of wood which come out to make a long row of tables on either side of the main aisle.The{spire}was added to the church about{1870.}The clock belongs to the community not the church. The bell,pulled by a rope,is rung every Sunday to call people to church at 11a.m.There are special services for weddings,baptisms and funerals.{The {stone figure of a Crusader lies in {the vestibule and was probably the {main part of a monument in the earlier {church.}In the churchyard there are many interesting old tombstones.
